text: Ladislav Lubina (11 February 1967 – 14 September 2021) was a Czech ice hockey player and ice hockey coach. He was drafted by the Minnesota North Stars in 1985. He never played in the NHL. Lubina won a bronze medal at the 1992 Winter Olympics, playing for the national team. Lubina was born in Dvůr Králové nad Labem, Czechoslovakia. Lubina died on 14 September 2021 of brain cancer in Prague, Czech Republic at the age of 54.Zemřel Ladislav Lubina (†54), získal tituly s Pardubicemi i medaile z MS ==References== Category:1967 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Czech ice hockey players Category:Cancer deaths in the Czech Republic Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Czech Republic
title: Ladislav Lubina
